intro: Corydalis longipes var. burkillii, commonly known as Burkill's longipes corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in spring. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in botanical collections.
